discourse_list.title: Need For Discord Report Scam Channel

content.content: As we can see Discord scams are increasing day by day So there is a need to create a Discord channel in which people can Report if someone is trying to scam them. People can share the screenshots and details of the scammers in that channel which will help the other members of the server to get aware of them.
Hi @Rahii, we already have a #Reports channel on Discord - although it has not really been used very much at all. Direct link here: Discord Anyone with the Community role should be able to access it.
It is not accessible for everyone. Even I am having community role but I can’t send messages to that channel.
Ah right, thanks for highlighting, I’ll get that sorted ASAP and let you know when it’s done
Thankyou in advance. Making it easily accessible is going to be very helpful because discord scams are at its peak these days.
@Rahii people with the Community role should have access to that channel now.

Hi @Patrick_J, you think could be possible the adittion of a bot inside the Discord that helps with scammers? Also, could be a great tool giving some CU members and/or delegates (for example) the hability to kick users that might be scammers.

@Patrick_J Thanks for making it accessible for everyone with community role. I agree with @Lozadaluis12 adding a bot to detect scammers, if possible is also going to be very helpful in reducing scams.
CU members should already be able to ban people. Happy to walk you through it if you need me to. A bot would probably need Tech-ops to set up and maintain it (pinging @dumitru)

@Rahii TechOps Core Unit is responsible for that. We already implemented and have different Discord bots running that filter:  Junk words and inappropriate phrases Spam links Multiple messages sent in a short period of time that can be considered spam Users trying to register with usernames containing specific words like admin, helpdesk, support, etc.  For all of above, actions are taken automatically and instantly by the bots. For everything else, I could suggest opening requests for TechOps Core Unit in #techops-requests private Discord channel (visible to everyone with MakerDAO role). Urgent requests from that channel are processed very fast by someone from the team that is currently online. Remember that we always have people on-call to take urgent actions whenever that is needed. You can also report it in the #reports channel mentined by Patrick_J, but then someone else would have to process it. I hope my answer helps. Let me know if any clarification is needed.
